Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary. In this case, the period inwhich the crew STARTED to add the additives. The period may extend over one ormore reporting periods.
Column Comment.2: CATALOGUE MUD ADDITIVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the kind of additive.The CAT_ADDITIVE table captures information about the package type and size foreach additive.
Column Comment.3: ADDITIVE SEQUENCE NUMBER: Number in sequence for multiple observations ofthe addition of an additive over the period, so that the total of additives or the amountof additives used at various times may be captured.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: ADDITIVE METHOD: The method used for adding the additive to the well bore. Whilethe patterns of addition may be complex, use this reference value to describe themethod generally.
Column Comment.6: ADDITIVE PERIOD: the period of time over which the additive is added to the drillingmud. Usually additives are put in over a period of several hours.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: END TIME: The time when the process of adding the additive is complete. Morecommonly the start time and the period over which the additive was added iscaptured, so this is calculated most of the time. Only use this column if you requirethis information in addition to the ADDITIVE PERIOD
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL shouldbe created.
Column Comment.13: QUANTITY COUNT: The number of units of the additive, as described inCAT_ADDITIVE . PURCHASE QUANTITY TYPE, that were added to the drilling fluidduring the period. For example, if two bags of additive were added, the number 2should be stored here. To determine the full amount, multiply by the PURCHASEQUANTITY column in CAT_ADDITIVE. Units of measure are usually stored inPURCHASE QUANTITY UOM.
Column Comment.14: QUANTITY VALUE: the quantity of additive added in the case where the amountcannot be calcuated from multiplying the QUANTITY COUNT by the purchasequantity in CAT ADDITIVE. Used for performance or to simplify queries, as this valuecanusually be calculated.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: START ADD TIME: The time of day when you first began to add the additive to thedrilling fluid. The period over which the additive is added may cross reporting periods,but should usually be stored in the period when the process was begun.
Column Comment.20: TIMEZONE: The timezone for the start and end times.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
